newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian MinFins ease with Bradys on Dow Jones fall.
newsitem.headline: Russian MinFins ease with Bradys on Dow Jones fall.

text.p: Prices of Russian MinFin bonds tracked the downward trend of emerging markets after sharp falls on Wall Street, dealers said on Tuesday.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average ended a volatile trading session off 157.11 points at 6583.48 late on Monday. MinFins closely track Brady Bonds and other emerging market debt.
"Trading opened lower as New York was selling MinFins late yesterday on uncertainty about the Dow Jones," Natsionalny Rezervny Bank dealer Denis Pakhomov said.
An International Moscow Bank dealer said prices went down further in early trading but later found support on short-covering.
Dealers said range-trading dominated the market awaiting further moves in U.S. Treasuries. They added trading was mainly seen between banks themselves as investors abstained from active moves.

They forecast prices were likely to fluctuate around the current levels or ease further on nervousness about a further U.S. interest rate hike, which many analysts expect could from the Federal Open Market Committee Meeting in May.
